snippet: Battalions of Sunni fighters stormed a village in eastern Syria, reportedly killing at least 60 people, in a reprisal raid that underscored the sectarian tone of the war.
abstract: Syrian government and opposition fighters and activists say that at least 30 Shiite Muslim villagers in eastern Syria were killed in reprisal raid by rebels, latest in string of massacres underscoring increasingly sectarian nature of Syrian conflict.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA and ANNE BARNARD

lead_paragraph: Battalions of Sunni fighters stormed a village in eastern Syria, reportedly killing at least 60 people, in a reprisal raid that underscored the sectarian tone of the war.

headline.main:
Dozens of Shiites
Reported Killed in
Raid by Syria Rebels
headline.print_headline: Dozens of Shiites Are Reported Killed in a Reprisal Raid by Syrian Rebels

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
